com.stevenmz.project1.domainTypes

Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stevenmz.project1.domainTypes.AddressBook

  • public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an address book. As such it holds a number of contacts represented by the AddressEntry class, and implements a number of common address book operations.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Steven Magana-Zook

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressBook()
      Constructs an empty AddressBook

      This method is used to find an entry in the current Address Book
      java.util.Set<AddressEntry> getContactsOrderedByName()
      This method will return the current entries of this AddressBook in alphabetical order.

      This method will initialize the address book based on entries in a file.

      This method will remove a single entry from the address book.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public java.lang.Boolean add(AddressEntry addressEntry)
        This method will add one entry to the address book
        Parameters:
        addressEntry - The entry to add
        Returns:
        True on successful add, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0

      • find

        public java.util.Set<AddressEntry> find(java.lang.String contactName)
        This method is used to find an entry in the current Address Book
        Parameters:
        contactName - The last name of the contact to find
        Returns:
        A set of all the entries whose last name starts with the string passed in.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getContactsOrderedByName

        public java.util.Set<AddressEntry> getContactsOrderedByName()
        This method will return the current entries of this AddressBook in alphabetical order.
        Returns:
        A sorted set of AddressEntry objects from this AddressBook

      • loadFromFile

        public java.lang.Boolean loadFromFile(java.nio.file.Path pathToFile)
        This method will initialize the address book based on entries in a file.
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - The path to a file containing Address Entries
        Returns:
        true when file was parsed, false if file contains errors.
        Since:
        1.0

      • remove

        public java.lang.Boolean remove(AddressEntry addressEntry)
        This method will remove a single entry from the address book.
        Parameters:
        addressEntry - The entry to remove
        Returns:
        true if the entry was found and removed, false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0

      • storeToFile

        public java.lang.Boolean storeToFile(java.lang.String pathToFile)
        This method will serialize all entries in this address book to disk
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - The path where the address book should be serialized to.
        Returns:
        True, if file was written, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
